content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Search for the course 'Exploring Quantum Physics' on Coursera, offered by the University of Maryland, College Park. Identify the percentage (rounded) of 5-star ratings in the reviews.  Please interact with https://www.coursera.org/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The current page is a promotional pop-up/ad related to Coursera Plus and is not relevant to searching for a course. There is no search bar visible. I need to scroll down to locate the main navigation tools or a search feature to begin searching for the course.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.05
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: There is still no search bar or main navigation visible for finding the course. I need to scroll down further to locate the course search functionality or navigation menu.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.05
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The page is still displaying promotional content and featured course cards, but there is still no visible search bar or input area to search for a specific course. Scrolling further may reveal the main navigation or search function.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.07
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search bar (input box) for searching courses is now visible on the page. I should type the course name "Exploring Quantum Physics" into the search bar to look for the specific course.
Action: Type 2; Exploring Quantum Physics
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.2
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The course "Exploring Quantum Physics" from the University of Maryland, College Park has appeared in the search results. To identify the percentage of 5-star ratings, I need to view detailed reviews or the ratings breakdown. I should click on the course to access its course page and review details.
Action: Click 10
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search results for the course "Exploring Quantum Physics" are still displayed. To find the percentage of 5-star ratings, I need to access the detailed course page and review breakdown, likely by clicking the course result.
Action: Click 11
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The view remains on the search results with the course "Exploring Quantum Physics" displayed. The next step is still to click on the course entry to navigate to the course details page, where the detailed review distribution (including the percentage of 5-star ratings) is likely available.
Action: Click 11
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The interface is still on the search results page, and the detailed breakdown for 5-star ratings is not visible. I need to access the course's detail page by clicking on the course listing to find the percentage of 5-star ratings.
Action: Click 11
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search results are displayed, with "Exploring Quantum Physics" visible. To view the breakdown of 5-star rating percentages, I must enter the course details page. Clicking on the course listing is necessary.
Action: Click 11
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search result for "Exploring Quantum Physics" is visible, but it only shows the average rating (4.2) and number of reviews (70), not the detailed breakdown of 5-star ratings. To find the required percentage of 5-star ratings, I must access the course's detailed page by clicking on the course result.
Action: Click 11
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The correct course, "Exploring Quantum Physics," is visible in the search results, but only the average rating and total reviews are shown. The percentage of 5-star ratings is not visible here. To find this information, it is necessary to enter the course's detailed page by clicking on its listing.
Action: Click 11
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The result for "Exploring Quantum Physics" is visible, displaying the university and rating summary. The needed detailed breakdown of 5-star ratings is not shown. To find the 5-star percentage, I should click on the course to access the details page.
Action: Click 11
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The course is visible in the search results with rating information, but the detailed review breakdown is not available. I need to click on the course listing to access more details, including the percentage of 5-star ratings.
Action: Click 11
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The course "Exploring Quantum Physics" by the University of Maryland, College Park, is clearly shown in the results, but there is no breakdown of the percentage of 5-star ratings yet. It's necessary to click on the course (element 11) to access detailed ratings and review statistics.
Action: Click 11
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search result provides the course name, university, overall rating (4.2), and review count (70) but does not show the detailed breakdown of 5-star ratings. To retrieve the 5-star rating percentage, I need to access the full course details by clicking on the course card.
Action: Click 11
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The course result for "Exploring Quantum Physics" is present on the page, but it only shows the overall rating (4.2) and review count, not the breakdown of 5-star ratings. To see the percentage of 5-star reviews, I need to select the course to open its details page.
Action: Click 11
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search result for "Exploring Quantum Physics" is still visible with only the average star rating and total reviews shown. To access a breakdown of reviews (including the percentage of 5-star ratings), I need to click on the course listing itself to go to its detailed page.
Action: Click 11
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.5

Note that <textarea> or <input> may be textbox, but not exactly. Please focus more on the screenshot and then refer to the textual information.
